title: Chain - Oil

Chain

Oil

Table of contents

Title
Chain - Oil
Procedure

List of figures

Title
Figure   Derailleur pivots (Sheet of 1)
Figure   Derailleur tension (Sheet of 1)
Figure   Brake lever pivots (Sheet of 1)
Figure   Lubricate the chain (Sheet of 1)

Required conditions

Condition Reference
The bicycle chain is clean and dry
 

Required person

Person Category Skill Trade Estimated time Number of persons required
Man A Operator Intermediate Bike rider 0,5 h  

Support equipment

Name Identification/Reference Quantity Remarks
Clean dry cloth
Part KZ666 / BSK-TLST-001-12
1 each
Floor covering
Part KK999 / PPP-001
1 pack

Consumables

Name Identification/Reference Quantity Remarks
Wet lube
Part KZ222 / LL-007
1 dl
Dry lube
Part KZ222 / LL-006
1 dl

Safety conditions

WARNING

  

Dry Lube is a very dangerous substance. Do not get it onto your skin. Use it in a well ventilated area. If you swallow it seek immediate medical advice. If it gets into your eyes wash your eyes in clean water and seek medical advice.

WARNING

  

Wet Lube is a very dangerous substance. Do not get it onto your skin. Use it in a well ventilated area. If you swallow it seek immediate medical advice. If it gets into your eyes wash your eyes in clean water and seek medical advice.

 Acknowledge security instruction
 You have read the safety instructions

Procedure

  1. Apply the penetrating lubricant into all the parts of the bike that move. This includes:
    • derailleur pivots (refer to Figure 1 )
    • derailleur tension (refer to Figure 2 )
    • brake lever pivots (refer to Figure 3 )
    These brake lever pivots include:
    • derailleur pivots
    • derailleur tension
    • guide wheels
    • brake lever pivots
    • control cables and where they go into their casings
       
    Figure   Derailleur pivots (Sheet of 1)
       
    Figure   Derailleur tension (Sheet of 1)
       
    Figure   Brake lever pivots (Sheet of 1)
  2. 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2
    Lubricate the chain.
     dev texst
    1. 2.1 A 2.1 A 2.1 A 2.1 A 2.1 A 2.1 A 2.1 A 2.1 A
      Make sure the chain is clean and dry.
    2. 2.2 B 2.2 B 2.2 B 2.2 B 2.2 B 2.2 B 2.2 B 2.2 B
      Put the Floor covering (PPP-001) on the floor below the chain.
    3. 2.3 C 2.3 C 2.3 C 2.3 C 2.3 C 2.3 C 2.3 C 2.3 C
      Use a Dry lube (LL-006) for dry conditions.
    4. 2.4 D 2.4 D 2.4 D 2.4 D 2.4 D 2.4 D 2.4 D 2.4 D
      Use a Wet lube (LL-007) for wet conditions
    5. 2.5 E 2.5 E 2.5 E 2.5 E 2.5 E 2.5 E 2.5 E 2.5 E
      Apply the lubricant to each roller of the chain (refer to Figure 4 ) but only apply a small quantity.
         
      Figure   Lubricate the chain (Sheet of 1)
    6. 2.6 F 2.6 F 2.6 F 2.6 F 2.6 F 2.6 F 2.6 F 2.6 F
      Hold the nozzle of the container above the front of the chain ring and slowly turn the cranks rearwards.
    7. 2.7 G 2.7 G 2.7 G 2.7 G 2.7 G 2.7 G 2.7 G 2.7 G

      CAUTION

       

      Do not get lubrication oil into the brake system. Oil in the break system can affect the efficiency of the bake system. Do not get oil onto the floor where it can easily get transferred onto the brake system.

      Let the lubricant soak into chain before you clean the unwanted lubricant from the chain.
  3. Do a check of the rear wheel rim and clean the unwanted lubricant if necessary.
  4. Do a check of the chain to make sure that each link is lubricated. If there are links that do not move easily or have become frozen, lubricate the chain again (refer to Step 2.2).
  5. Do a check of the remaining lubricated parts and clean the unwanted lubricant with a Clean dry cloth (BSK-TLST-001-12).

Requirements after job completion

None
